Edamame /dmme/, or edamame bean, is a preparation of immature 
soybeans in the pod, found in the cuisine of China, Japan, Korea and Hawaii. 
The pods are boiled or steamed and served with salt. In Japan, it is usually 
blanched in 4% salt water and not served with salt. ... The Japanese name, 
edamame, is used commonly to refer to the dish.
